The '''deep frozen ocean''' is a deep variant of [[Frozen Oceans|frozen oceans]]. Unlike the regular frozen ocean, the water surface is not covered with ice, though [[Iceberg (feature)|icebergs]] still generate in the water.

== Description ==
[[File:Ocean colors.png|thumb|200px|The separate colors of each ocean variant {{in|java}}.]]
The deep frozen ocean is the rarest ocean biome, covering 1.12% of the [[Overworld|Overworld's]] surface area and 3.78% of the total ocean area.

The deep frozen ocean biome generates at deeper waters and can also contain [[ocean monument]]s. [[Iceberg]]s may still generate, but unlike the normal frozen ocean, the water's surface is not frozen.<ref>{{bug|MC-131587|resolution=WAI}}</ref>

With [[Vibrant Visuals]], deep frozen oceans use default environmental settings with a strong cold color grading, making the biome appear colder blue.

== Sounds ==
When in any ocean biome, unique ocean [[ambience]] play randomly. Normal overworld tracks also play, alongside "Axolotl", "Dragon Fish" and "Shuniji", as the requirements for those are merely to be underwater rather than biome-determined.

== Trivia ==
*Before [[1.18]], regular and deep frozen oceans could generate near any kind of biome. It was somewhat common to see an [[iceberg]] bordering a [[desert]], [[savanna]] or [[badlands]] in ''[[Bedrock Edition]]''. Until 1.18, frozen oceans had a rough regular ocean border to minimize this effect in ''[[Java Edition]]''.
